alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued June 23 at 4:14PM MST until June 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 414 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Buckeye to near Phoenix International Raceway to near Bapchule, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 114 and 136, and between mile markers 150 and 168. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 199. US Highway 60 between mile markers 173 and 178. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Tolleson, Laveen, Cashion, Palo Verde, South Phoenix, Liberty and South Mountain Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
